result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald L. Shepard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

Huber for work counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve 2nd half on home monitor if he qualifies after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Court will allow him to serve that time in Winnebago or Outagamie County if Portage County agrees.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.

Require to maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Participate in counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Participate in the Domestic Abuse program deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Write letter of apology to Ethan Kumm.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations if his agent feels that is appropriate at this time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald L. Shepard

records.addlTxt: Atty Henry Schult picked up the exhibits on 08/31/22

Letter to Atty Henry Schultz in re:  return or original exhibits 
Defendant:  #D2

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald L. Shepard in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF90, 14CT191
1:35 p.m. Court calls the cases. 

State files amended information. 
Atty Schultz received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.

1:42 p.m.  Atty Schultz makes statements re: the plea as he believed it was.  Asks for a moment to speak with his client. 
1:47 p.m.  Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court.  Removes the State's request to file as a repeater in both counts and asks the Court to remove the repeater allegation.  States additional recommendations.  Unfortanetly, the parties do not have a plea agreement at this time. 
Atty Schultz indicates he does not agree to the 1 year in jail.  Makes additional arguments to the Court. 

Court will schedule for a pre-trial conference. 

Atty Schultz indicates they are willing to proceed on the 2 misdemeanors without the repeater. 
Court questions Atty Schultz. 

Atty Schultz requests to meet with Atty Molepske. 
1:51 p.m.  Court is in recess. 

2:11 p.m.  Court is back in session.  Appearances remain the same. 
Atty Molepske states the new plea agreement as recommended. 
Atty Schultz makes statements re: letter of apology request to one of the victims. 
Atty Molepske indicates that 14CT191 will not be resolved at this time.  

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 
15CF90 Count 1 - GUILTY
15CF90 Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
 
Atty Schultz makes statements re: facts and stipulation. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2 (No repeaters).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schultz makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Exhibits #1 and #2 are marked on behalf of the defendant. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibits #1 & 2 are received. 

Atty Molepske makes additional statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Schultz. 
Defendant responds. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 


BY THE COURT:
15CF90 Count 1 - 
Serve 6 months jail 
3 days credit
Huber for work counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve 2nd half on home monitor if he qualifies after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Court will allow him to serve that time in Winnebago or Outagamie County if Portage County agrees. 

Defendant makes additional statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant consults with his attorney. 
Court advises the defendant that this statement he is filing will become part of the court record. 
Court reviews the statement. 
Court questions the defendant.  

Count 2 - 
Serve 9 months jail, consecutive to Count 1. - STAYED
Placed on probation for 2 years: 
Obtain AODA and comply with treatment recommendations if his agent feels that is appropriate at this time. 
Required to maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Continue fulltime employment. 
Participate in counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Pariticipate in the Domestic Abuse program deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Write letter of apology to Ethan Kumm. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge and the DNA surcharge.
 
Atty Schultz argues for 3 days jail credit. 
Atty Molepske makes statements. 

BY THE COURT:  14CT191 will be set for a pre-trial conference. 
Atty Schultz indicates his client asks for him to withdraw on this case only. 
Defendant concurs. 
Court questions the defendant re: waiver of counsel. 
Defendant makes statements.  If he appears with an attorney, he will have another attorney.  
Court questions if he wished to proceed with the plea in 15CF90.
Defendant indicates he is. 
Court questions the defendant further. 
BY THE COURT:  Court will allow the withdrawal of Atty Schultz. 

Atty Schultz asks for clarification of when probation starts. 
Court indicates it will start today.

Defendant Ronald L. Shepard in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.

$2,000 signature bond:   Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  No contact with Ethan Kumm, Elizabeth Haka, Tesserant Stroik, Kristoffer Wise, or Robin and Kristine Bowholtz or their residences.

Defendant Ronald L. Shepard in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  DA Molepski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.  Time limits are waived.  Companion case is 14CT191.  
Parties will go to Br 1 to get Preliminary Hearing date.
State requests $2,000 cash bond.  No contact with victims or their residences.
Atty Schultz requests a sig bond.
BTC: $2,000 signature bond:   Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  No contact with Ethan Kuhn, Elizabeth Haken, Tesserant Stroik, Christopher Wise, or Robin and Chrintine Bolholz or their residences.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald L. Shepard not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions if the complaint was mailed to the defendant's last known address. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.  There was an attorney consulted. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will continue for 2 weeks.  A copy of the complaint should be sent to Attorney Hank Schultz as well.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
